definition: to drill (i.e. plant seeds in spaced rows)
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]

sentences.english: Finally, the elastic transformation using smooth thin- plate spline interpolation is performed.
sentences.chinese: 最後利用薄板樣條播值函數完成彈性變換。

sentences.english: The machine vision method was adopted to realize automatic detection of performance for metering mechanism of a drill.
sentences.chinese: 運用機器視覺技術實現條播排種器性能的自動化檢測。

sentences.english: The grain was sown in drill.
In our experiment, heavy rain was received shortly after the plots were (had been) drilled.
sentences.chinese: 在我們的試驗中，這幾塊地條播後不久就下了大雨。

sentences.english: There is interest in solid drilling or broadcasting soybeans either by field equipment or by airplane .
sentences.chinese: 對大豆使用農田機械條播或用飛機撒播是有興趣的事。
